Full Description: Tlon is the corporate vehicle of the open-source Urbit software stack (urbit.org).  Urbit is a clean-slate reimplementation of the whole system software stack. On the bottom it's a replacement of the lambda calculus, in the middle it's a new functional programming language, on top it's a purely functional network operating system in which address space is property. Tlon owns approximately half of the entire address-space on the Urbit network. The goal is to create a new layer over the Internet the way the Internet layered over the PSTN.  This layer can also earn adoption by providing Internet services.  On the Internet, your Urbit ship is a general-purpose personal cloud computer which replaces the 47 special-purpose cloud silos you're currently using. Tlon's mission is to contribute to the development of Urbit, to provide hosting services for Urbit ships, and to develop other possible business applications on top of the Urbit stack.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Developer Platform, Open Source
Description: Tlon is the corporate vehicle of the open-source Urbit software stack (urbit.org).
Headquarters Regions: San Francisco Bay Area, West Coast, Western US
Founders: Curtis Yarvin, Galen Wolfe-Pauly, John Burnham

CAS enables enterprise IT departments and service providers to rapidly migrate and on-ramp enterprise workloads to GCP, including virtual desktops and applications, graphic workstations, hybrid Active Directory (AD) environments, AD-based disaster recovery, and Windows and Linux virtual machines. CAS drastically reduces the time and cost of managing GCP infrastructure and end-user computing environments all through an intuitive single pane of the glass management portal. itopia was founded in October 2013 by Ubaldo Don and Jonathan Lieberman. It is based in Miami, Florida.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Cloud Infrastructure, Information Services, Information Technology, SaaS, Software, Virtual Desktop
Description: Itopia is a desktop-as-a-service solution for Google Cloud Platform, providing an end-to-end automated and orchestrated software.
Headquarters Regions: Greater Miami Area, East Coast, Southern US

Full Description: Lexbe Inc. is a leading provider of cloud-based/SaaS eDiscovery software and services to U.S-based boutique law firms, and boutique practice groups in larger general service law firms.  eDiscovery is the legal discovery of electronic documents and other electronically stored information (“ESI”) as part of civil or criminal litigation.  eDiscovery involves a number of processes usually performed with specialized software, including the secure collection, transfer, processing, metadata extraction, OCR, search, tagging/coding, Bates-stamping, attorney privilege logging, confidential information/PII tagging and redaction, legal production, deposition preparation, timelining/case chronologies, motion practice, and trial preparation.  ESI used in connection with eDiscovery includes email, word processing, spreadsheet, presentation and other office files, social media and other web pages, computer databases, and virtually anything that can be stored on a computer and can be read only through the use of computers.  This data is the critical evidence used by attorneys in modern commercial litigation. Lexbe offers customers licensed use of the Lexbe eDiscovery Platform (LEP), which is cloud/SaaS-based eDiscovery software.  LEP features and functionality include electronically stored information DIY upload/ingestion, electronic file archive extraction, metadata extraction and fielding, processing, OCR of image files, text extraction of native files, search index construction and maintenance, search interface and saved searches, hard-coded and custom created coding fields, standard and customized reports, automatic and custom privilege log creation, PII and other confidential/proprietary information identification and coding, redaction editing, transcript management, legal fact & issues/chronology construction, briefcases, legal productions and other exports, end-to-end encryption and other security protocols, and prepopulated and custom litigation workflows. Lexbe’s market is boutique law firms and boutique practice areas in larger law firms (“Boutique Law”). Boutique Law customers usually prefer a DIY on-demand eDiscovery software solution, to allow law firm staff to handle most eDiscovery matters in-house themselves.  We believe that the Boutique Law market is growing at an above-average rate in the legal vertical and demands new innovative solutions to legal discovery.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Ediscovery, Legal, SaaS, Software
Description: Lexbe is a leading provider of cloud-based/SaaS eDiscovery software and services to U.S-based boutique law firms and practice groups.
Headquarters Regions: Southern US

Full Description: Caylent is a cloud native services company that helps organizations bring the best out of their people and technology using AWS. To thrive in a software-defined world where technology is at the core of every business, organizations need to empower their people and processes through technology. Caylent is uniquely positioned to fuel that engine of innovation by bringing ambitious ideas to life for our clients. Caylent is obsessed with accelerating time-to-value and our track record is backed by years of experience working with clients to solve their most complex challenges. Caylent’s team provides both insight and guidance where it matters most. Through a combination of expert advice and implementation, we see around corners and anticipate needs before they become challenges. We are forward thinking, exploratory in our approach, and pride ourselves on true partnership with our clients. Being a partner means engaging together in a focused effort to drive our clients’ vision and achieve both technical and business results. Caylent was born in the cloud as a cloud native organization with roots in building developer tools. Our mission from day one has been to help companies accelerate their cloud native journey. We recognize that there is  a shift in the way software is built, deployed, and managed and that running applications in the cloud can be challenging. Since our formation, we’ve been an active member of the open source community focused on helping companies at all stages of their cloud journey maximize the value of their technology investment through open source.   Our commitment to the open source community includes membership in the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) and status as a Kubernetes Certified Service Provider (KCSP). This dedication to community extends to our philosophy, mindset, and investment in our people and practices. Our commitment to learning and career development includes providing time for engineers and architects to study, train, and get certified on the cutting edge technologies that our clients value. This dedication to continuous learning enables us to have opinions grounded in experience and best practices, which is a strong value-add to our clients who look to our team to solve the most complex technical challenges. Caylent’s core practice areas include Cloud DevOps, Cloud Migration & Modernization, Cloud Data Engineering, Cloud Native Applications, Cloud Security and Compliance, and Cloud Platform Monitoring. We also provide innovative services through our Extended Reality and Machine Learning practices. We deliver via an Agile, iterative approach through scoped projects or as an elastic capacity-based subscription model depending on the best fit for our client's needs.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Cloud Infrastructure, IaaS
Description: Full spectrum AWS Cloud Native and DevOps consulting partner
Headquarters Regions: Greater Los Angeles Area, West Coast, Western US

Full Description: Cobalt Iron is the global leader in SaaS-based enterprise data protection. Through analytics and automation, Compass from Cobalt Iron enables enterprises to transform and optimize legacy backup solutions into a simple cloud-based architecture. Processing more than 7 million jobs a month for customers in 44 countries, Cobalt Iron delivers modern enterprise data protection for enterprise customers. Cobalt Iron reduces overall capex by more than 50 percent while eliminating backup failures and inefficiencies. Cobalt Iron uses a SaaS based, pay as you grow model. This means we don’t over-charge with pricing packages. Instead, we only bill you for the exact amount of data you need backed up and protected. This allows us to easily scale with your business while simultaneously cutting your data storage and backup costs by upwards of 50%. At the same time, our platform allows for you to easily observe and manage backup and protection processes from one, easy to understand interface. This means you no longer have to switch between several software offerings just to see what your data is doing. This has helped our customers to reduce complexity and increase productivity by over 80%.

Full Description: Mist is an open source multi-cloud management platform. Our goal is to make multi-cloud simple and offer a single interface from where you can manage everything. Mist supports all popular infrastructure technologies including public clouds, private clouds, hypervisors, containers and bare metal servers. It provides a unified interface for performing common management tasks like provisioning, orchestration, monitoring, automation and cost analysis. It comes with a RESTful API so you can easily integrate it into your existing workflows. Our customers include large organizations like the European Parliament, National Bank of Greece, SevOne, Shoprite and more. Our customers report 40%-60% reductions in server bills and management overheads, four times faster roll outs and twice as fast incident response times. Mist comes in three editions. Mist Enterprise Edition (on-prem) is ideal for large teams with advanced needs around orchestration and access controls. Mist Hosted Service (SaaS) is easy to get started with and is ideal for highly dynamic infrastructures. Mist Community Edition is our open source version, for teams with a DIY approach.

Full Description: miniNodes are tiny dedicated servers that run Linux on ARM processors.  miniNodes can perform the same functions as a regular server, at a fraction of the cost and power used by a normal server. Available with either 32 or 64-bit ARM processors similar to those in smartphones and tablets, miniNodes can host cloud services and applications, serve websites, crunch big data, provide failover capacity, run IoT services, and more. Why miniNodes ARM Dedicated Servers? Microservers have several advantages over traditional servers and cloud servers: Microservers use drastically less power than a traditional server, helping save energy and the environment. Microservers are less expensive to own and operate than a traditional server. Microservers are physical hardware nodes allocated only to you, and are not shared or hosted in a cloud. Thus your data is isolated and security is superior to virtual machines. Further, ARM Dedicated Servers are great for developers, students, and web designers: Developers building mobile apps for Android, iOS, and Windows RT can build, test, and deploy code on the same ARM Cortex architecture that most mobile phones and tablets run on. An ARM Dedicated Server can be used to verify code runs properly on the ARM platform, or to host back-end services for mobile apps. Students can use ARM dedicated servers to learn Linux, system administration, hosting, and programming while taking classes and gaining skills. Because they are inexpensive, microservers are a great learning platform and educational tool. Web designers can use a microserver as a cost effective way to host customer websites. This is an example of “right-sized” computing, where the largest, fastest, most expensive server isn’t necessary to handle low-traffic, non-resource intensive websites. A microserver is sufficient, and is a much more cost effective way to host sites.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Web Hosting
Description: miniNodes develops ARM dedicated servers that helps its users’ hosts cloud services, websites, and applications.
Headquarters Regions: Greater Phoenix Area, Western US

Our Motto is "Thinking Agile | IoT | Edge | Data | ML | AI | Cloud | Digital | Smart City Solutions - Think Clovity"​ as your Global Solutions Partner and Systems Integrator focused on transforming enterprises worldwide. Clovity’s success is founded on industry thought leadership and technology innovation that is IoT, Cloud, Consumerization and Big Data focused, for several verticals including Telecom, Banking & Finance, Healthcare and Retail industries.  Clovity has developed real world use cases and 'disruptive solutions'​ for these and many other industry domains.  Clovity is on the forefront of working with its clients on 5G-IoT to put together the components of a next generation Smart City roadmap including: Smart Infrastructure, Smart Buildings, Connected Healthcare, Connected Devices, Connected Energy, Connected Services and much more. Clovity’s global engineering and technology teams are helping Fortune 500 and mid-market technology companies implement fully integrated device-to-cloud-to-enterprise solutions.  The impressive outcome will simplify and grow your Internet of Things (IoT) solutions, provide data to cloud interoperability & enable digital platforms for tomorrow's connected world. Clovity's commitment to innovation has led to the creation of our plug and play IoT frameworks called CSensorNet and, coupled with Clovity’s Predictive Analytics platform called CDataInsights, these capabilities drive new opportunities for cost savings and ROI in areas of DevOps, Cloud Migration, Mobility, IT to OT integration and also enables a faster time to market for product launches. Clovity underpins its solutions with 'deep Agile expertise'​ by leveraging its Agile Framework called Synthesis™ in every aspect of implementation to ensure complete structure for methodology, collaboration and transparency. Clovity’s goal is first to create scalable technologies as a foundation and second architect and build for all future advancements in innovation.
Industries: Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Cloud Computing, Cloud Data Services, Consulting, Embedded Software, Internet of Things, Retail Technology, Smart Cities, Software

Full Description: ClearSky Data’s global storage network simplifies the entire data lifecycle and delivers enterprise storage as a fully managed service. Its storage is designed for business agility. ClearSky simplifies enterprise storage by providing an SLA-based managed service across the global network. The company's patent-pending Smart Tiered Caching continually categorizes data and places it in the right cache layer (hot, warm, cold) based on evolving usage requirements and customer policies. Customers simply scale as needed, using the ClearSky dashboard to add unlimited capacity with a few clicks.   All data can be moved across the ClearSky network to meet a variety of use cases including data center migration, load balancing, expansion into new regions, or disaster recovery. ClearSky has partnered with major public clouds to place hot and warm cache copies at the cloud edge. The result: customers get low-latency access to cloud instances, providing a new cost-effective option to run their most demanding workloads. The total cost of ownership (TCO) of storing data using the ClearSky service is about 1/3 the cost of managing it in a company’s data center on physical storage arrays. By leveraging the architecture and building redundancy into all cache layers and network paths, ClearSky is able to provide an enterprise-class service with guaranteed high availability. Industry-leading security technologies and best practices ensure that customer data is always protected and isolated from the moment it enters the ClearSky network.  Customers simply plug into the ClearSky service to get the storage they need, when and where they need it, with the security, scalability, and resilience that a business depends on.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Data Center, Enterprise Software, Virtualization
Description: ClearSky Data is a VC-backed startup in stealth that is building breakthrough technology solutions in enterprise infrastructure.
Headquarters Regions: Greater Boston Area, East Coast, New England

Full Description: Swim provides the first open-core, end-to-end platform for continuous intelligence at scale. Swim helps organizations transform their business operations by maintaining situational awareness and continuously augmenting human decision-making, using the most accurate, relevant data possible from processing and analyzing real-time and contextual data in concert. Recognizing that humans are real-time beings, Swim’s founders designed Swim products with humans in mind – making Continuous Intelligence applications work the way users do. Swim offers Swim Continuum, the first open core, enterprise-grade platform for building, managing and operating continuous intelligence applications at scale. It provides businesses with complete situational awareness and operational decision support at every moment. Built on the open source SwimOS core, and thanks to its unique, stateful architecture, which eliminates latency-prone database queries, Swim Continuum provides unprecedented performance and efficiency for operationalizing high-frequency data analytics and real-time visualizations of massive amounts of streaming and contextual data. Its single, production-ready platform monitors and manages all Swim operations, creates engaging, connected user experiences and seamlessly interoperates with existing enterprise systems. Chris Sachs, Rao Arimilli, and Rusty Cumpston founded Swim in February 2015. Its headquarters is in Campbell, California.
Industries: Analytics, Big Data, Business Intelligence, Cloud Computing, Enterprise Applications, Open Source, Real Time, SaaS, Software, Web Apps

Our easy and affordable, end-to-end solution accelerates business transactions and allows interaction with spaces in ways never previously possible.       Our core technology includes a mobile app for 3D capturing reality, cloud software for 3D reconstruction and an easy-to-navigate photorealistic 3D viewer, soon to be available in VR. Full Description: Kodiak Data is serving a market need that has emerged at the confluence of three shifts in the industry: growing adoption of Big Data, shift to private and public cloud, and containerization. Big data workloads and clustered workloads have different requirements than do web and machine-to-human workloads and, thus, are served neither efficiently nor scalably by existing cloud solutions. Kodiak Data has developed an edge cloud solution that solves the infrastructure demand for Big Data. The product fits seamlessly between the user, and their public cloud or on-prem infrastructure, and requires no major implementation on the end of their customers. Since deploying the solution with revenue generating customers in Q4 2016, Kodiak Data has seen 5X lifts in speed and dramatic cost savings in customer case studies. At its core, Kodiak Data is a software company that containerizes clusters for big data developers and IT. The team has deep technical expertise in networking, virtualization and storage, and is supported by advisors and investors who are leaders in the database, virtualization and networking industries. Institutional investors include Data Collective (DCVC), Divergent Ventures, and Aspect Ventures.

Full Description: Based in Austin Texas, Cloudtools was founded in 2014. The story of Cloudtools actually begins earlier at Virtual Bridges, an established player in the virtualization space and the source company from which Cloudtools spun out. At the time, Virtual Bridges was bringing a new product to market, a cloud orchestration solution for orchestrating workloads in multi-cloud environments. During the development period they ran into the same roadblock that Cloudtools customers encounter every day: the time-consuming and difficult task of moving a virtual machine from one environment to another. Virtual Machine movement has been next to impossible yet it is a problem affecting any administrator who has a need to move to a different virtualization platform. We had an advantage when it came to dealing with this roadblock: our development team was dev-ops focused. We had developers who approached this problem with a deep understanding of the operational aspects of virtualization, and had first-hand experience dealing with real-world virtualization problems such as moving VMs. At this point we decided to solve the movement problem once and for all. This is when we formed Cloudtools and created Shift, the drag and drop solution that lets you move any virtualized machine from anywhere to anywhere. Shift is our first product to market that helps to solve the tough problems faced by cloud and virtualization administrators every day. Whether you need a tool that lets you switch to AWS, switch to Hyper-V, switch to Azure or you are having problems or issues with VMware or just want to move to the cloud, Cloudtools has developed the solution to help you. At Cloudtools, our mission is simple: We make tools that let IT professionals spend a few minutes handling tasks that would otherwise take hours or days.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Software, Virtualization
Description: Cloudtools developed the industry's first drag and drop solution that allows you move any virtualized machine from anywhere to anywhere.
Headquarters Regions: Southern US
Founders: Kelly Jones, Ph.D., Mike LaPeters, Sam Cece

Full Description: Daisho is the developer of the Nalej™ platform, an Edge PaaS for the implementation and organization of container services in geographically distributed heterogeneous resources. The platform facilitates the administration and centralized organization of the latest generation of telecommunications and third-party services enabled by 5G, as well as a set of tools provided by Nalej™ for distributed monitoring, analysis, unified management of resources and administration of the cycle of Infrastructure life. The platform provides advanced technologies for Kubernetes,  Serverless Computing and Unified Resource Management enabled by ML/AI. In addition, Nalej™ allows developers to define workloads along with a descriptor that details the requirements of resources, capabilities and security, as well as interconnectivity within and between applications. Workloads are implemented in the appropriate resources in a completely transparent manner, while optimization opportunities are continually analyzed by reorganization and / or replication of the application as necessary. In this way, Daisho, which has been incubated by the Airbus Bizlab accelerator, provides IT/OT/Ops teams and developers with an application implementation model for the normalization of computing, storage and network resources distributed, which allow the secure and real-time delivery of services in distributed environments that include cloud and advantage. It currently operates internationally, in countries such as the United States, California, Spain and Germany, with notable investors such as Data Collective, Sinewave Ventures and Boldstart Ventures.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Cloud Infrastructure, Cloud Management, Information Technology, Internet of Things, IT Management, PaaS, Software

Full Description: Mysafeplace is an exciting new way to manage and protect your documents, time, pictures, contact and more in One Place, making  them accessible to you from anywhere. Mysafeplace is a cloud based service which is launching now.  There are full document management features, and picture galleries with the ability to securely share specified information with anyone using ""secure share links"".  Our calendar features allow subscribers to dynamically create events and tasks with email and text reminders.  There is also a section for managing your contacts and even launching a skype call from the application.  More advanced features are being added for time management, tasks and goal settings. The goal of mysafeplace is to become a tool for people to effectively  preserve and protect the important  items in their lives and to help manage their day to day activities and goals.  The security allows subscribers to comfortably collect information and share it.  There are three levels of service.  The first is for a single user and is $5.00 per months.  It provides 10GB of storage and all features are included. The next level is the Family Plan for $15.00 and adds more storage and 5 members to this group plan.  Each has their own personal space and a shared group space.  You can imagine a family creating a family photo gallery and still have separate personal galleries.  The next plan is the Community Plan for $25.00 and adds even more storage and expands to 10 group members.  New members and storage can always be added. The team has extensive experience in Cloud Computing and software application development. Very low cloud costs allow us to effectively push a free 14 day trial and drive users to a paid level.   We are seeking an investment of $250,0000 to grow the business,  expand our development team and execute on our marketing plans to grow our subscriber base.

Full Description: Traken Technologies, LLC is a Phoenix based, veteran owned Technologies Company developing an access control system with a secure mobile-cloud processing system. Initially focusing on preventing access to un-secured alcoholic beverages and to help local convenience stores reduce loss due to theft. While increasing convenience, future revenues and safety of the retailers and their customers. Traken has engineered and developed the HopsLock™ ID Verification System for use by retailers of beer. The HopsLock™ device serves as a deterrent to would be beer thieves by leveraging the responsibility of access to the beer coolers to the customers of the retail stores and taking the burden off employees and managers.  After querying several local convenience store locations in a major chain throughout the valley we have discovered that beer theft, on average accounts for approximately $7,000 per quarter and some locations have reported upwards of $30,000 in theft per quarter.  By combining our current system with the MOBICLOUD and utilizing the IP's algorithm we will be able to store/retrieve the data from each swipe of an ID. This information can then be SECURELY and wirelessly transmitted and retrieved anywhere from the secure cloud. This data will be used in several ways to include: Prosecution of crimes committed against retailers, data collection and analysis of market, specific target advertisement based on collected data. The aforementioned features will initially create an immediate deterrent to those who commit beer theft crimes against retailers.The evolution of the IP will allow future products to be accessed remotely and securely which will give us a unique ability to safely retrieve customer's data without the risk of identity theft. The secure wireless abilities allow us to cut costs during installation by eliminating the dependence of wired devices and onsite hard drives. By lowering our cost we directly lower our customers cost and are capable of delivering a superior product at appropriate prices.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Information Technology, Security
Description: Mobile Cloud Access Control Security
Headquarters Regions: Greater Phoenix Area, Western US
Founders: Joshua J. Snow, Paul Skiera, William Peterson

Full Description: Realtime Scale-Independent Analytics, Visualization, Search and Discovery The Internet of Things is creating a growing demand from companies for a new kind of realtime analytics system that can handle sensor data at extreme scale. A single company might need to continuously analyze data from millions of live streams, with terabytes of new data coming in every day. They need realtime actionable insight, enabling them to instantly discover important opportunities and threats, and to respond to them immediately. At Palo Alto Data we’re building the first IoT Intelligence app - an app that enables companies to continuously capture, aggregate and index any number of IoT data streams from fixed or mobile sensors, to visualize, analyze and search the data in realtime, to set custom realtime alerts, and to algorithmically discover and rank important events and patterns automatically. The app is built on industry-standard big data software and cloud services.  It’s massively scalable, super-fast and simple to use. The app can be run on-premise or accessed as a cloud service. Contact us for more information.
Industries: Analytics, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Data Visualization, Internet of Things, Machine Learning, Real Time, SaaS, Search Engine

Full Description: High-Performance Development, Hosting & Management for Creatives SiphonLabs is a high-performance, cloud-based development, hosting and management platform for creatives that is launching from the SoftLayer Catalyst Startup Program. It supports multiple content management software (CMS) platforms and will evolve to include additional CMS and ecommerce solutions that will enable developers, designers and agencies to manage website development across a range of platforms and host live websites for themselves or their clients, all from a single, intuitive dashboard. The SiphonLabs platform simplifies development, maintenance and hosting processes, freeing creatives to focus on what they do best—designing and developing great websites. Two of the most popular CMS platforms, WordPress and MODX, will be available at launch. An ecommerce solution, potentially Magento, is likely to become the third option, with Drupal and Joomla! following. Built around innovative “Siphon” processes, tasks that have traditionally required a reasonable level of technical skill and have taken hours, sometimes days, can now be completed in a fraction of the time, freeing users to focus on their core design and development activities.  What are the Key Platform Features? - One cloud solution with multiple site-building options. - Ability to launch, clone, move, share and test sites in seconds with the Snapshot feature. - 7-day rolling automatic backups for both development and live sites, with access to restores from the dashboard 24/7. - Collaboration with clients and other users by connecting accounts to manage and share cloud sites and development activities. - Intuitive dashboard that reduces complexity to a handful of clicks and is easy to use for all technical levels. - Highly secure, blazingly quick clouds on high-spec infrastructure with hosting options in multiple global datacenters (North America and Europe available at launch). - Software-specific support and knowledge available through SiphonLabs "Cloud Coaches" (support team). - Value-added services such as domain purchasing, email mailbox purchasing and setup, and SSL certificate purchasing and management, will be introduced later this year.
Industries: Blogging Platforms, Cloud Computing, Web Hosting
Description: Premium Managed WordPress Hosting
Headquarters Regions: Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex, Southern US
Founders: James Bohan-Pitt, Kevin Marvin, Shaun McCormick

Full Description: e-Magik is a cyber security startup addressing secure connectivity, whether it’s our businesses, our phones, our homes or cars – made by Apple, MS, Intel, Google or Samsung…Mobility is no longer the point. Mobility is expected. Securing this connectivity is the point! This is why we developed “Fluid security” — eM-Connect™. The entire eM-Connect™ ecosystem was designed and developed with you in mind. “User Experience” really matters! End users want what they know and know what they want. Sysadmins face layers upon layers of complex systems and tasks. Service provider margins are tight, complexity is really expensive. Developers need a flexible, secure connectivity “snap in” to simplify development. We've made secure connectivity accessible and simple, by focusing on the entire ecosystem’s User Experience. The eM-Connect™ platform addresses modern “Web Scale” systematic approaches to provide scalable, distributed, secure, and reliable connectivity services. To be clear “Web Scale” is not an acronym for “Big” It’s about dynamics, like: what to scale, when to scale and where to scale, based on: users, content, location, network stability and hardware status. Our “fluid security” methods let eM-Connect™ scale from SME to Google levels because of design. Our new system of flexible secure connectivity solutions provides, at runtime, encapsulation of existing internet and network transport protocols, allowing existing applications, resources and services to benefit from our secure connectivity methods without needing to redevelop these programs. Our “Snap-In” provides a simple secure development environment to bring new, disruptive products to market in the fields of financial services, healthcare, entertainment, IoT and many others.

Full Description: Retrivika:tm: offers a new approach to collaborative legal eDiscovery. With patent pending large collection review tools, Retrivika:tm: shortens the review process by giving the legal professional products that are easy to use and in line with the users natural search process.  With use of the cloud, our system provides collaborative tools that allow teams to review and work together from anywhere in the world.  The flexibility helps to saves time, which lowers costs for both users and clients. To improve efficiency and productivity, Retrivika's:tm: process combines the exploration and discovery process into a single interface. Throughout our research and development, we found that users frequently search through documents without much knowledge of the information contained within a collection. With a combined search and discovery process, users can easily examine and learn about the collection in one step. Retrivika:tm: understands that legal organizations have changing needs and demands.  We have eliminated all per user fees, allowing you to easily shift your workforce between cases and collections without incurring additional costs.  With our SaaS product, there is a monthly access fee and storage pricing per GB.  Retrivika:tm: also provides detailed billing for each collection, giving you exact client costs and taking the guess work out of your client billing.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Ediscovery, Legal, Software
Description: Retrivika are retrievers & providers of simplified information of the research papers & publication.

Full Description: Texan Hosting is a web hosting company based in Houston Texas. We offer web hosting and cloud hosting to businesses and consumers on our private server network. We primarily target the market of currently purchasing or recently purchased direct mail advertising companies and individuals, who will want to have excellent web hosting and a nice website for their future customers and patrons. We also offer our graphic arts and web designing services to small businesses and consumers who are looking for a custom touch to their newly created or renovated websites. This is a lucrative business. We offer excellent customer support to our customers. We offer 24 hour customer support and guaranteed 99.9% uptime on their websites. We also off very fast propagation times for our customers transferring websites, which can be a notoriously slow process with some of the bigger more well established hosting websites. We offer a fully functional website where customers and businesses can visit and purchase goods and services, such as hosting, email hosting, and website design and logo creation.  The company is run and was founded by general manager Blake Harp. He brings with him a background in hosting for one of the largest web hosting firms in the nation, hostgator.com. He also brings with him much personal experience. Some of our creative work is done in house, and some is outsourced.  Texan Hosting's mission is to partner with direct mail advertising companies and let them offer their products and services under their own name or if they would like they can have a manger account, which is offered under the companies name, as well. This is a great offer for some smaller direct mail advertising companies as they do not have the ability to fully dive into their own web hosting business. This will also give these companies the appearance of being a much larger company than they might actually be, and will overall be a great compliment to their current services for their custom.
Industries: Cloud Computing, Consumer, Web Hosting
